column4: anyone else get error when they try to launch gnome control center?
gnome-control-center users-account
does that work for anyone?
how can I get alt+tab to work properly?
it won't show byobu terminal in alt + tab
very annoying
What does this mean?
The following packages were automatically installed and are no longer required:  msr-tools libaio1 seabios cpu-checker vgabios
HELP
it means that those packages were installed for a package that has gotten removed - 'sudo apt-get autoremove' will get rid of them
no, but the ubuntu-restricted-extras package should include flash
i know chromium browser has built-in flash right?
once mounted, it will show up at the mount point ;-)
'sudo mkdir /media/isofile'
sounds like your ISO file is corrupted
what is the output of 'file isofile.iso'?
then psycho_oreos is right - it's not an ISO file
file would've said this (or something like it) if it were an ISO file: # ISO 9660 CD-ROM filesystem data 'Ubuntu 11.04 amd64             ' (bootable)
it is
yes
you're dealing with proprietary software designed for Windows - that requires some hacking sometimes (and patience all the time)
